name: Delta Calgary Airport

reviews.text: I ended up staying here for 2 nights and 3 days for business meetings. The hotel itself is obviously super convenient as it is actually right at the airport. The rooms are 'ok' and probably not reflective of what they are charging for them, other than the location. THey aren't terribly soundproof or modern but the beds and bedding are very good and there is a fridge in the room. The hotel has a pool but it's right in the lobby so it doesn't see much action. Staff were very helpful and were very prompt when dealing with issues (a blow dryer in the room that died).
reviews.title: Hotel is good, restaurant was excellent

reviews.text: The big plus was the restaurant. While the basic menu was good (breakfast sandwich, beef dip, chicken sandwich) the dinner steak menu at North 51 Steakhouse was amazing. We all had steaks one night and they were cooked to perfection. I had the tenderloin with goat cheese and mushrooms that was simply amazing. Also 'Tony' was excellent at ensuring we were taken care of and that we had a great dining experience. Don't mistake this for a casual airport hotel when it comes to dining. Venture out and have the higher end menu, you won't regret it.
reviews.title: A simple and great choice for a between flights airport stay.

reviews.text: Delta is almost always a good choice. This place is very soundproof - you do not hear the aircraft even though you are right in the middle of it all.
reviews.title: friendly, professional, convenient

reviews.text: Watch the web for deals - there are often discounts on weekend stays that really take the cost down.
reviews.title: Very convenient and well appointed if you need to stay at the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i have stayed at this hotel several times and enjoyed each stay, its so nice to not have to worry about transportation to the airport in the early mornings. The beds are very comfy, the rooms are clean and quiet. Bar staff is very friendly and make you feel right at home.
reviews.title: perfect for early get-away

reviews.text: Great location etc. However the room I had (702) was in dire need of an update. Gaping hole in the console where the fridge used to be, scratched furnishings and room trim, worn and dirty looking carpet, cheap looking furniture and dated TV. I have stayed in better Deltas and certainly have stayed in better hotels in this price/quality range, however location location location won (and the associated convenience) this place three stars, otherwise it would have been a two.
reviews.title: Agree with everything said here-Room Very Worn (Out)

likes.disliked: — Worn out and outdated room and furnishings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ..........it was raining when we arrived in Calgary from Toronto, but as there is a covered walkway from the aiport straight into the hotel we didn´t get wet at all!! Very speedy and efficient receptionist and in minutes we were in the lift going to our room (526) which was very clean, well planned and good quality toiletries in the bathroom in abundance.
reviews.title: No need to get wet.....................

reviews.text: We had drinks in the bar and the service was excellent. Dined out with friends - many restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Convenient for Travellers

likes.liked: — convenient access to the airport and facilities
likes.disliked: — no rooms with view of the airfield

reviews.text: Breakfast was included in the rates and as a buffet it was very good, with great selection of hot and cold food.
reviews.title: Very friendly staff, convenient hotel

likes.liked: — convenient location, nice king size bed
likes.disliked: — very low bathroom appliances (vanity, bath etc)

reviews.text: Travelling on the next morning to Banff (car hire office is right next door) - otherwise we would like to have stayed longer in this hotel............maybe next year?
reviews.title: Good airport hotel in perfect location

reviews.text: At first I was really apprehensive about staying at a hotel that is physically at the airport. But I gave in when I realized since I am working at the airport, the cost of the car rental and hassels and expense of parking did not make sense.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again

reviews.text: When I got off the plane, I called to get directions to the hotel from within the airport. The girl on the phone said, "it was at the other end of the airport," which didn't help. So I looked at a map and realized it is at post 3,4 or 5 and there is a direct walkway to the hotel. Very nice considering it was a cold and windy night.
reviews.title: Great location, great service, no wireless in the room - huh?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel and room is very clean. The room was very quiet and seems to be very well insulated since the airplane noise did not wake me up or disturb my sleep.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The folks at the front desk are very courteous and professional.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The night I go there I went to the hotel bar to have a quick drink and wings. I took approx 20 minutes to get my food and service was less than quick.
reviews.title: Super service

reviews.text: We arrived in Calgary very late at night and could not check into our apartment until the next morning. This is great because it is attached to the airport so we didn't even have to worry about a rental car until the next morning. The front desk staff was very nice and gave our little guys each a toy to keep. The room itself was a bit small but beds were comfortable. They also accept pets for a fee which was great because we had our small dog with us. The pool was a good temperature and the kids enjoyed that too.
reviews.title: Great for late night arrival

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The forecast was for up to 30 cm of snow so we decided to head to the airport the night before. Staff at the Delta was very friendly and professional. We were checked in and up to our room within minutes (and before the check-in time). The room was nice and quiet. The wireless internet worked great. Our room on the 6th floor wasn't renovated but everything looked great - only difference we noted was an older style tv. We enjoyed being able to cruise the airport in the evening to get some exercise, scope out where our gate was, etc. Close and convenient and you don't even have to go outside to get to the airport!
reviews.title: Stayed overnight to avoid winter driving before flight!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Delta Calgary Airport for just one night, March 4th, upon returning from a vacation in the Mayan Riviera. We found it difficult to actually find the hotel from the airport arrivals terminal, there are no signs showing the way. We luckily found a YYC volunteer who pointed us in the right direction.
reviews.title: Excellent service and convenience!

reviews.text: When we arrived we were checked in quickly by very friendly staff. Our 22 month old daughter even received a stuffed parrot from the staff to her great delight! We were also informed we received a complimentary upgrade to an 8th floor renovated room, and told of the Delta's "Just like Home" program which would provide our daughter with a cookie and glass of milk whenever we liked. How cute!
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service and Hotel

reviews.text: We used the services of a bellman to help bring our pile of luggage up and he was extremely courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Very convenient
Convenient location
reviews.text: One thing this hotel has advantage over others is its location, you only need to cross the bridge from the main terminal to get to this hotel. Staff is friendly, no compliant there. However, the room that I was in, as well as the lobby area, was really dated and tired looking, felt like I was in a time warp, and can't wait for the renovation to be complete. However, I also noticed the wall between rooms was quite thin, as I could hear the coughing from my neighour. I am not sure if the renovation can solve this problem. The gym was adequate, but cramped. Oh, and no wifi in the room, hope that's part of the renovation as well.
We stayed here before catching a plane. This is a very convenient choice at the airport. But for $230, we'd expect better.
reviews.title: Decent but not great

reviews.text: Pro's
reviews.title: Now THAT was a great sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Convenience: Located right in the airport, you can't get better than this.
reviews.title: Quick Lay Over

reviews.text: 2. Pool: Can be fun with kids. Hot tub as well.
reviews.title: Comfy and friendly, but a bit dated.

reviews.text: I agree with many of the positive comments about this hotel. I think you lower your expectations on sound when you stay at an airport hotel. But the doors in this hotel are designed with an automatic closer that SLAMS when it shuts. Even if you try to prevent that from happening--the doors close so slowly until the last few inches--it is hard to prevent--I tried. The slamming doors can be heard at all hours of the day and night in your room. For the most part the hotel is in decent shape the rooms are clean--while not brand new-they are in decent shape.
reviews.title: Incredible convenience undermined by slamming doors!

reviews.text: The hotel staff are efficient, friendly and helpful. As with many hotels, the lobby and public areas are nicer than the rooms.
reviews.title: What a good manager does

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the hotel is average and only average--if it were not at the airport I would probably keep looking. But you don't even have to go outside to get to the airport--just use the second floor skywalk! So if you want easy access this is your place. If you don't mind being jarred awake by slamming doors this is also your place
reviews.title: bedbugs

reviews.text: We sometimes get busy in life and forget to do the basics. I recently travelled to Calgary on business and stayed at the Delta Calgary Airport Hotel. Upon arrival, I realized that I had failed to make a reservation. Upon "trying to check in" the reservation assistant informed me that I did not have a reservation. She quickly called over Kayod the manager who informed me that the Hotel was booked to capacity for the night. I reesigned myself to having to go out and hunt for accomodations at 10:00 at night when the manager started searching the system for options. He was able to override several things in the system, and not only did he get a room for me, but also overrode the last minute pricing and got a 20% reduction to the RAC rate at the last minute. Now that is service. I am grateful and suggest the Calgary Airport Hotel for its wonderful staff who value their customers.
reviews.title: Average Airport hotel

reviews.text: This hotel not only gave us bed bugs but when we tried to complain they would not only give us a room to stay in, but they took the further step to tell us they would call the police if we did not leave the hotel.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: I have used the Delta hotel six times over the past eight weeks due to early morning departures or late night arrivals. It is more expensive than comperable hotels about a mile away,but one just can't beat the convenience of walking out the hotel door and into the airport terminal. The rooms are surprisingly quiet given their proximity to the runway. The check in staff is extremely friendly and most importantly efficient and it takes about a minute to get my key and be on my way. They keep track of my room preferences and I'm never surprised. The restaurant food is very good. I find better value in Compass than Club 51 which is the more expensive steak house, but service both places is very good. The concierge is terrific and helped me across the street to the terminal with my mountain of baggage.
reviews.title: Extremely practical and restful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An older property with maintenance issues, but it is clean and you can walk there from your flight.
reviews.title: Perfect location, average hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Delta for one night. Arranged for an early checking before arriving but they had no record of that when I arrived. However, the front desk was able to find me a room.
reviews.title: Very convenient. Great Service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food in the lounge was good and I recommend the roasted corn soup.
reviews.title: A Murphy Bed?? Seriously??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wireless in the lobby only was a bit of a pain as I had my iPad not my laptop. Additionally, the wireless was brutally slow where it was available.
reviews.title: Convenient But Average Overall

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is very convenient but I don't think it is worth the money at all since there are so many nice hotels near the airport with free shuttles. The room was small and very dated, furniture was well used and counters scratched etc. The pool is in the lobby very near the front desk, so you really felt like you had to be very quiet.
reviews.title: Very Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We toured the Rockies on our honeymoon, and stayed one night at the Delta Calagary because we had an early flight to Vancouver. I could not fault the locaton of the hotel because Air Canada check-in was right across from hotel. The rooms in the hotel are in need of severe modernisation. I was very shocked when I went into our room which looked awful. The room had a severe odour, faded carpert, old furniture, and the bath tub had black stains all over the bottom. Also, we had a severe draft coming from our door that I had to put pillows at bottom of door to keep draft away. This is not the standard of your typical Delta hotel that I have stayed in the past. Since I was only staying there for one night I did not make a fuss, but I will not stay in that hotel again.
reviews.title: Poor

reviews.text: This hotel is by far the worst Delta property that I have stayed at. It needs major upgrading.
reviews.title: Needs updating badly!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off I was in town on business that was close to the airport so I chose to stay at the Delta airport because I like the Delta properties. I had rented a car to get to and from work, and to go and see the town...... I had two options of where to park the car.
reviews.title: Functional but a little old-fashioned

likes.disliked: — Pool in reception and restaurant area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. You can park valet at a price of $35 a night. The valet is never around, and it takes forever to get your car, eventhough it is parked right outside the front door. I called down twice to get the car brought around and no one picked up the phone.
reviews.title: Great stay

likes.liked: — So convenient to the airport for a stopover

reviews.text: We stay here a few times a year while connecting as we come from northern BC so we always have to layover. The front desk staff have always been so friendly. I even arrived once and my luggage didn't. Within minutes they had everything I needed for the night to be comfortable. (toothbrush, paste, brush and comb, deodorant, shampoo, robe etc.)
reviews.title: always stay here when connecting and have never been disappointed!

reviews.text: The food is always good and we love to have a drink and appetizers in the lounge before continuing our travel the next day.
reviews.title: Happy Customer-KH

reviews.text: The rooms are small but we are okay with that. They are incredibly clean and nicely decorated. Since we are only there over night, the smallness isn't an issue.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Yes. The rooms are completely sound proof. We didn't hear a thing.
reviews.title: Time to renovate!

reviews.text: Basically, we book here right away when we see that our travel has a layover and we have never been disappointed.
reviews.title: A great sleep

reviews.text: I booked the room weeks early, and got in very late in the middle of a blizzard. The room I reserved was not available - got upgraded to a "smoking room" that stunk of cigar smoke, I was told the couch made up to a bed for a second person, no linen, and when I called the lobby got a "duh" response - went down to see the reception, and after much delay - finally got someone to come up and make up the bed - a sheet and bedspread! Both my mother and I are very sensitive to smoke - not a nice night. Then we were given passes for buffet breakfast - waitress was rude and buffet uninspiring. Very poor surprise at 0200. Plus there was some confusion as to whether I paid what I had reserved for or for the "upgrade". Fortunately the windows opened and we were able to partially air out the room - with a raging blizzard blowing in.
reviews.title: Booking ahead no guarantee

reviews.text: Stayed for convenience as nothing else close by - but in future would reconsider choices.
reviews.title: Small but comfortable

reviews.text: This was our first stay at the Delta. We have considered it in the past prior to flying out of the Calgary airport but the prices have been too expensive. This stay they had a promotion and we were able to stay for $144.00 a night plus tax. The front desk staff wasn't very helpful but did answer questions asked. She didn't ask for our aeroplan number and later when I discovered they accepted it I returned to the desk for them to credit it. It would have been appreicated for her to have asked us about it. The room was small but comfortable and clean. We could occassionally hear the planes but it wasn't bothersome. The pool is small but clean. We didn't use the restaurants as they are too expensive.
reviews.title: Rooms a bit tired

reviews.text: Convenient if you are getting in late on a flight but the rooms are a bit tired and smelled like jet exhaust in the morning.
reviews.title: Very Convenient But No Other Reason to Stay Here
Good hotel for airport
reviews.text: I had a painfully early flight out of YYC (7 AM + Int'l Customs) so I spent one night here. Bathrooms are a bit European (small & spartan) but the room featured plenty of desk space for work, plenty of power outlets, a fridge, and a king-sized bed.
Main consideration was being on site of airport for early morning flight. Though the room was not large the facilities were good and the staff and swimming pool were great.
reviews.title: Handy for Airport

reviews.text: Did not like the smell of aviation fuel in the corridors but the room and other public areas did not smell.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

likes.disliked: — Smallish room, but that was no big deal

reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable and we heard no noise from the airport.
reviews.title: Overpriced and rooms need updating

reviews.text: This hotel partly shows its heritage as a former member of the Canadian Pacific chain; it's nicely decorated (especially for an airport hotel) and some of the old CP silverware is still around, a nice touch. There's nothing really remarkable about this building, but its location--the only hotel connected to the terminals at Calgary International--is a big convenience. The rooms, while on the small side, are absolutely silent and very well appointed (the bedding was excellent and we slept very well), and there's a nice-sized pool and hot tub, strangely located in the atrium lobby. We had a decent lunch in the bar (a good alternative to the giant Sunday brunch buffet, the only other choice on a Sunday afternoon) and enjoyed a long chat with the very friendly bartender. The front desk staff is a mixed bag: some very friendly and helpful (one gave us very good tips on using public transit to get downtown, an alternative to the $40 cab ride), others extremely rude. I suppose this means some training is in order, but on the whole this is an above-average airport hotel, and I do recommend it.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Wonderful front desk agents.

reviews.text: I actually stayed in two different rooms on consecutive nights as a one night visit turned into two thanks to a cancelled Air Canada Jazz flight.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: I stayed at the Delta Calgary Airport Hotel for one night prior to my early morning flight home. I paid $279 plus tax for one night. The room was quite small, but very clean and modern. The TV was brand new and worked very well. The Internet access was easy to set up and worked perfectly. The dinner I had at the restaurant on the first floor was very good, and the service was pleasant and prompt. (I did not eat at the steakhouse -- I ate at the more reasonably priced restaurant with a greater variety.) The bathroom was pristine.
reviews.title: Great, Quiet, Clean Airport Hotel

likes.liked: — Clean modern rooms, literally AT the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is connected to the airport. You just check out at the front desk and walk through the airport doors to catch your flight.
reviews.title: Very handy for the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint was the slow check-in and check-out at the front desk. I had to wait at least five minutes for each before being served. There did not appear to be any way to check out automatically.
reviews.title: Great !

likes.liked: — Very convenient location for the purpose.

reviews.text: I didn't hear any airplanes or other airport noises at all in my room that night. Slept like a baby.
reviews.title: Beyond disappointing

reviews.text: I highly recommend the Delta Calgary Airport Hotel if you have an early flight out.
reviews.title: A fine place if you need a convenient airport location

likes.disliked: — Need to upgrade look and feel of rooms

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel twice traveling with work and for attending meetings. The staff are very professional, helpful and very friendly. The quality of food at the restaurant is outstanding. The beds are very comfortable and rooms are quiet, clean, and very nicely decorated. You have a work desk in your room if you need a place to send a couple of emails or surf the net. I do find the bathrooms to be a bit small but nonetheless they serve the purpose. I do enjoy the line of amenities they provide in the room.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: As for meeting rooms this hotel has a variety of sizes to meet your needs. If you have any issues or concerns the staff are available right away to make it right. I will stay at this hotel again if traveling for work or fun. The best part of this hotel is that it is right across from the airport.
reviews.title: Top notch

reviews.text: I stayed here a few weeks ago for work. I was not disappointed, the concierge helped me find the small terminal my flight was leaving from the next morning by making some phone calls and writing me out directions. There were fresh apples at the check-in desk. I used the gym and it was fine, a little small but nothing to complain about. I ate at the restaurant 2 times, both times the food was great. I really liked the crab bisque, the stirfry had too much sauce but it was a fine experience both times. I normally stay at the Delta downtown so this was a nice surprise. Even the parking, which could have been quite complicated, was made easy by the front desk.
reviews.title: Great place to stay when your flight is delayed

reviews.text: WestJet gave me a room here when my flight was canceled.
reviews.title: Great beds, comfortable rooms

reviews.text: The halls are very long if they put you out on the end of one of the wings, but the room was very clean and comfortable. It's not a destination hotel, just a great place to keep you close to the airport while you wait for your flight. The hotel is attached to the airport.
reviews.title: Great, if you can sleep in a room at 21 Celsius.

reviews.text: This is our second stay at this hotel for early morning flights. Overall we are not impressed. The convenience can't be beat, a short walk from your room to the departure areas. There is no airport noise in the rooms, however the rooms overlooking the courtyard and pool area get a lot of inside noise. Also the beds are not very comforatable and have overly stiff and noisy bedding. We also found, on both occassions, that the in-room, express checkout didn't work at 4:30 am. If you are a sound sleeper or by yourself, these items would probably not be a issue. After trying this option twice, next time we will opt for comfort over convenience and stay at one of the much less expensive offsite hotels. We feel that this hotel is very overpriced for what you get.
reviews.title: Not great

reviews.text: We recently spent one night at the Delta Calgary Airport while travelling on business.
reviews.title: Convenient for Early (or Late) Flight, but Otherwise Unremarkable

likes.disliked: — Charge for high speed internet access.

reviews.text: This hotel is great if you have an early morning or late night flight at Calgary Airport. It is connected by an enclosed walkway to the airport terminal, which is very convenient. It is also connected to the car rental lots. This is the greatest feature of this hotel.
reviews.title: Very convenient, nice pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise, it is quite an ordinary place - neither exceptional nor poor.
reviews.title: Very convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One positive is the dining selection on-site. There are 3 restaurants/bars in the lobby, and each are quite nice. This included one of Calgary's better known steakhouses.
reviews.title: Great to relax after long-haul

likes.disliked: — No view, but we didn't expect one!

description: Conveniently connected by indoor walkway to the Calgary International Airport, we offer a stress free beginning to a vacation as well as an excellent meeting location for your conference or social event. The Delta Calgary Airport offers a variety of meeting facilities and beautifully appointed award-winning restaurants and lounge. The direct access to the Deerfoot expressway and Highway 2 allows for quick transportation to the businesses within the north, south or west end of the city, and a short 15 minute drive to the downtown area.
